page.title: 09Craven Arms Market.
page.content: On the 12 June we went to visit the market.Craven Arms market is relatively busy being a border town close to the uplands of Mid-Wales and situated in a rich agricultural area of Shropshire. At 11.00 a.m. the bell rang which signalled that the sheep selling was to begin.There were farmers everywhere.The sheep sold at prices ranging from 50 to 250 pounds.After being sold the sheep have their ear clipped to show they have been sold. After the sheep had been sold we moved into the cattle ring.The cattle being sold today were Hereford/Friesian cross.The cattle were put into the ring through a green gate which was closed behind them. This led them onto the scales to be weighed.
